summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing a proposed presentation by the Boston InfraGard chapter on the efforts to locate and capture Ghislaine Maxwell. The New York FBI office advises against proceeding due to the recent appeal of Maxwell's verdict and the possibility of a retrial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a proposed InfraGard presentation about the efforts to locate and capture her. Her recent jury verdict was appealed, and a retrial is considered a possibility.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, copied on the email chain regarding the proposed presentation.

events.title: Appeal of Ghislaine Maxwell Verdict
events.description: The defense appealed the jury verdict against Ghislaine Maxwell. The judge is reviewing the case due to a recent interview given by one of the jurors, making a retrial a distinct possibility.

events.title: Proposed InfraGard Presentation on Maxwell Capture
events.description: The Boston InfraGard chapter proposed hosting a webinar on the New Hampshire efforts to locate and capture Ghislaine Maxwell, focusing only on the arrest steps, not the investigation or trial material.

keyFacts: The FBI's Boston InfraGard chapter proposed a webinar presentation detailing the efforts to locate and capture Ghislaine Maxwell in New Hampshire.
The FBI's New York office advised against the presentation proceeding due to the appeal of Maxwell's verdict and the possibility of a retrial.
The proposed presentation was intended to cover only the steps taken to locate and arrest Maxwell, not the underlying investigation or trial details.
The appeal and potential retrial were triggered, in part, by a recent interview given by one of the trial jurors.
